did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: The Review of Contemporary Fiction/Dalkey Archive Press : records,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: John O'Brien founded The Review of Contemporary Fiction (RCF) in 1980 and established the Dalkey Archive Press three years later. Since its inaugural Spring 1981 issue, RCF has appeared with exact regularity three times a year. Each number is devoted to one or two contemporary figures, predominantly American and British but also some European writers as well. The contents of a typical number include original work by the writer featured, an interview with him or her, a memoir or other biographical reminiscence by literary colleagues, and several extended critical articles. The Dalkey Archive Press began as a modest adjunct to RCF, issuing reprints of books by writers featured in the journal, or associated with those writers. Then in 1986, O'Brien began issuing original works.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Gilbert Sorrentino material is partially restricted. Stanford holds no copyright to the material in the collection, only physical rights.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Review of Contemporary Fiction/Dalkey Archive Press : records. M0507. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, literary manuscripts, typescripts, proofs and final copies, uncorrected galleys, as well as interviews with contemporary writers.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.title: The Review of Contemporary Fiction.
controlaccess.subject: . 0$aAmerican literature--20th century.
